nameEntry.part: Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs, Western Australia

biogHist.abstract: Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs, Western Australia is a very large collection of photographs of people and Homes run by the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (1942-2009). These records are now held by Global Mission Partners. There may be photographs from: Bamburra Hostel, Carnarvon Hostel, Carnarvon Mission, Fairhaven Hostel, Norseman Mission, Roelands Village and Wollaston.
biogHist.p: Access to records is restricted to protect the privacy of individuals. You are very welcome to enquire.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board (Inc) (1942 - 2009)

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs, Western Australia', in Find & Connect - Western Australia,

bibref.title: Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs, Western Australia

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: Oval and playground, Carnarvon Mission' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the early 1980s

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Roelands Campsite, Busselton' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from 1983 and shows the campsite that was part of Roelands, on Caves Road between Busselton and Dunsborough. Camps were held on weekends and during school holidays for children who couldn't go home to family. Eventually, the campsite was released by the Shire Council to a local Aboriginal consortium.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Roelands Village, view' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from 1978 and shows the blue dining room on the right and the church in the middle. At the back, in the centre of the photograph in front of the hill, is the schoolhouse that had been used during when the property held the Roelands Native Mission Farm.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Roelands Village, sign' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from 1978 and shows the sign into Roelands Village, with the Village itself in the background.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Bethany kindergarten dormitory, Norseman Mission' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the 1950s and shows the 'kindergarten' dormitory for little children, which was known as 'Bethany'.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Teens Hostel' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the late 1960s. The hostel was established in 1968 as part of the Carnarvon Mission. The image shows the hostel (which was also called the 'Town Hostel') on the left, with the Christian Centre's hall in the middle and the church on the right.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Mission School' is a digital copy of an image from the Carnarvon Mission, held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image shows the original mission school, probably around 1948.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Carinya scatter cottage' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from 1980 or 1981 and shows one of the 'scatter cottages' in the Carnarvon township that were part of Ingada Village (which was the new name given to the Carnarvon Mission in 1975).

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: 'Fairhaven Hostel 1965' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from 1965 and shows Fairhaven Hostel as it was when it was first purchased by the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: Wollaston is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. Historian Deslee Moyle confirms that the image was taken in the early 1980s.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: Carnarvon Mission children and sign' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the early 1960s.

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: Carnarvon Mission from the air is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the 1960s. The dining room is on the left of the photograph, with the U-shaped 'Kindergarten' in front. The kindergarten was the babies' and young children's dormitory

archref.repository: Global Mission Partners, Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: Bamburra exterior' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the 1970s.

archref.repository: Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs
archref.abstract: Norseman Mission, view' is a digital copy of an image held by Global Mission Partners in the Churches of Christ Federal Aborigines Mission Board Photographs collection. As described by historian Deslee Moyle, the image dates from the 1960s and was taken from the schoolhouse. In the foreground is superintendent's house; the red roofed dining room is to the left; and the building with the silver roof behind the dining room is the workshop, which held the lighting plant and other maintenance equipment. A number of the Homes for children are visible, and the tennis court is on the far right of the picture.
